Menu.name: Pina Colada

Menu.name: House Red
Menu.price: Served slightly chilled by the glass or carafe

Menu.name: Bodegas Recuero 'Siglo' Moravia 2010
Menu.price: This wine is very special to us. We are one of very few restaurants in the us to serve it. It is made from moravia (brujidera), an obscure grape indigenous to the toledo region of spain. The grape is almost extinct. This wine is a taste of what spanish wines were like more than a century ago. Please ask your server for the whole story.

Menu.name: Poppy Pinot Noir
Menu.price: At once new world and varietally true, poppy is an easy pinot noir expressive of the sunny and cool climate of monterey.

Menu.name: De Angelis Lacrima Christi Del Vesuvio Rosso 2012
Menu.price: The grapes are called "the tears of christ" either because of their greek antiquity, their aching sublimity, or their indeterminate teardrop shape. The varietals are ancient, the soil is old lava, and the wine is as italian as my father-in-law, which is to say, molto.

Menu.name: Gramercy Cellars 'Southern Blend" Columbia Valley
Menu.price: My first thought on tasting this wine was, "this wine should teach kissing lessons!". Elegance, balance, and a finish that is at once powerful and tender. Washington state syrah/grenache blend.

Menu.name: Domaine De Couron Coes Du Rhone 2012
Menu.price: A favorite of ours since the restaurant opened. Great with our food or on its own; medium-bodied with wonderful ripeness and weight.

Menu.name: Semaphore 7 Reservation
Menu.price: Alicante bouschet is one of the only grapes in the vitis vinifera family to have dark red flesh in addition to red skin. More anthocyanins might engender more and wilder phenolics, but i might as well describe the human heart by saying something about ventricles. Here is the blazing north african climate of alentejo (complete with romantic visions of moorish horsemen) harnessed by the rainy catholic plodding of lisbon into one bloody tear-miracle droplet on a pink sandstone virgen among a riot of manueline artichokes and side-saddle archery slits. Ah portugal!

Menu.name: Stolpman 'La Cuadrilla' Syrah/Grenache 2012
Menu.price: The crew that pick grapes at stolpman winery are spanish-speaking, and la cuadrilla refers to them. All of the proceeds from the sale of this wine go to the vineyard workers. Big, tannic, full-bodied red wine that would love to have some stuck or duck with you.

Menu.name: Bonny Doon 'Le Pousseur Syrah 2012
Menu.price: The perennially hilarious randall graham of bonny doon gives this syrah all of the rustic structure and and country heft of the ancient rhone valley, while dressing it in the modish fashions of present-day california, that we are all of us too young to wear. The rare wine that manages to be be authentic and accessible at the same time.

Menu.name: Caggiano 'Tari' Aglianico 2012
Menu.price: Aglianico was the favorite grape varietal of my 20s, and it remains a young man's wine. Obstinate tannin, unpredictable herbs, and the decidedly middle-brow pleasure of a big red wine that manages to smuggle cherry cola into its midpalate all make for a wine better suited perhaps for a rustic dinner of boar in the damp caves of ancient taurasi than civilized dining in downtown raleigh. Perfect with the ribs

Menu.name: Colli Dells Murgia Mazzaro Cabernet Blend 2008
Menu.price: This southern italian cabernet blend balances ripeness and tannin perfectly. The supporting aglianico grape adds spice and structure to the cabernet's fruit.

Menu.name: Zlatan Plavac 2010
Menu.price: Plavac mali (plaa-vahtz) is an ancient croatian grape varietal, the distance ancestor to modern zinfandel. This rich, gorgeous red wine is extracted, tannic, brambly, and unique. It is a taste of what great wine might have been in the time of alexander the great. From the southern croatian region of dalmatia, an up-and-coming corner of the wine world.

Menu.name: House White
Menu.price: Served by the glass or carafe

Menu.name: Cantina Taburno Falanghina 2013
Menu.price: Great acidity, like biting into a ripe anjou pear. If this wine were a shape, it would be a bright green isoceles triangle.

Menu.name: Chimago Torrontes 2012
Menu.price: Floral and round, white peaches and gardenias. White shoulders and a little black dress, the tango yet to begin.

Menu.name: Chateau L'oiseliniere De La Ramee Muscade 2012
Menu.price: Six months on the lees, and with the adorable puppy fat to prove it. Minerality, acid, and beautiful weight on the palate. I've never had a bad glass of muscadet in my life, and i don't intend for you to tonight

Menu.name: Pullus Pinot Grigio 2012
Menu.price: Extended skin contact makes this "white" wine almost rosé in color and adds gorgeous structure and weight. I am a long-time devotee of bidoli pinot grigio, but this slovenian offering has won a place in my heart. Versatile and easy to drink with all of our food.

Menu.name: Clos Guiroulih Jurancon Sec 2012
Menu.price: I spent an hour trying to find the t.rex Lyrics that this wine reminded me of (and it was an enjoyable hour) before i realized that no single line or guitar hook could capture the way this strange, beautiful, golden wine made me feel. The closest i came is the horn part in "girl", on electric warrior. Amazing stuff

Menu.name: Catalpa Chardonnay 2011
Menu.price: "Call the roller of big cigars, the muscular one, and bid him whip in kitchen cups concupiscent curds." - From "the emperor of ice cream" wallace stevens

Menu.name: Blanck Gewurztraminer 2013
Menu.price: Alsace snuggles between france and germany in an interwar wintertime train car, her wines full of roses and honey, and her demure facade disguising the valkyric rhinemaiden that lives in her heart. Sweetness and perfume and steely resolve, a perfect match for our spicier dishes.

Menu.name: Alysian Russian River Selection Chardonnay 2011
Menu.price: Balancing on the thin wire of elegance that stretches above the teeming abyss of oaky butter juice, this is exactly what russian river valley chardonnay always hopes to be but rarely is. Pleasure, weight, fat served elegantly on china, not blasted from a hose into a trough. Fois gras compared to the insipid movie theater butter flavored spray of many producers.

Menu.name: House Rose
Menu.price: Served by the glass or carafe

Menu.name: Thierry Tissot Bugey Brut Nv
Menu.price: In raleigh, the question of whether it is bojangles or biscuitville or beasley's that has the best biscuits is one that could give rise to shouting matches and rifts in families. The real answer, though, if we are being honest (and believe me it pains me to say so, as a native) is france, and more particularly french sparkling wine. Yeast and oak and ethereal citrus bake biscuits in a flute to make you slap your mama.

Menu.name: Venturini Baldini 'Roncolo' Dry Lambrussco Nv
Menu.price: Lambrusco suffers from an erroneous perception in the us that it is all cloyingly sweet wine for teenagers. This very dry lambrusco proves that there is a grown-up side to these wines. Walnuts, balsamic, and stewed strawberries. Wonderful with the pad thai.

Menu.name: Barnaut Grand Cru Ros Champagne Nv
Menu.price: Explosive! A riot of red fruit and muscular acidity. Could stand up to a filet.

Menu.name: Billecart-Salmon Vintage Brut 'Blanc De Blancs' Grand Cru Champagne 1999
Menu.price: Vintage grand cru champagne, properly aged, from one of the great houses. High scores from tanzer and parker alike. It's good. Drink it.

Menu.name: Pierre Moncuit Brut 'Millesime' Grand Cru Champagne 2005
Menu.price: "Three be the things i shall never attain: envy, content, and sufficient champagne." Dorothy parker

Slackjawed Jezebel
Menu.desc: Bourbon, Lemon Curd, Ginger Syrup, Fresh Lemon Juice, Sugar Cane Syrup. Sure to be one of the most popular drinks in Raleigh. The Jezebel takes bourbon, house-made lemon curd, house-made ginger syrup and fresh squeezed lemon Lop juice to leave you slackjawed by its flavor

Menu.name: Mountain Mule
Menu.desc: North Carolina Moonshine, Fresh Ginger Syrup, Fresh Lime Juice, Sugar Cane Syrup. The mountains have plenty of moonshine, so let's use some to make a drink

Menu.name: Whiskey Bramble
Menu.desc: Bourbon, Cherry Amarascata, Fresh Lemon Juice, Orange Blossom Water, Sugar Cane Syrup. The tartness of the cherry marries well with the sweetness of bourbon to create a delicious whiskey drink. We add some fresh squeezed lemon juice along with a few drops of orange blossom flower water and sugar for a sagacious libation

Menu.name: Strawberry Moon Sangria
Menu.desc: House Cabernet, Strawberry, Fresh Lemon Juice, Italian Cherry Syrup, Rose Petal Water, Vodka. Nicknamed by Native Americans, the full moon near the summer solstice was a signal to pick strawberries at the peak of their ripeness. We used their advice and made a cocktail with them

Menu.name: The Aviation Cocktail
Menu.desc: London Dry Gin, Maraschino Liqueur, Fresh Lemon Juice, Violette Liqueur, Sugar Cane Syrup. This 1917 cocktail has become one of the more popular classics in bars where drinks are done right. Its tartness is clean and quenching while the sweetness is dry and refreshing

Menu.name: Hemingway Daiquiri
Menu.desc: Aged Rum, Maraschino Liqueur, Fresh Grapefruit Juice, Fresh Lime Juice, Sugar Cane Syrup. Let's all thank Ernest for his love of alcohol! Without him we wouldn't have this delicious concoction

Menu.name: Flower Power
Menu.desc: Vodka, House-Made Hibiscus Syrup, Fresh Lime Juice, Fresh Orange Juice, Orange and Lime Essential Oils. We mixed vodka with our sweet and aromatic, house-made hibiscus syrup, vibrant, acidic lime and orange juices, and immune system boosting essential oils that add a rich, smooth texture to the cocktail

Menu.name: Strawberry Beret
Menu.desc: Bourbon, Fresh Lemon Juice, Strawberry Purée, Sugar Cane Syrup, Rhubarb Bitters, Egg White, Dark Chocolate. You won't find this beret at a second hand store. Tart lemon juice helps balance the sweetness from the strawberry, egg white adds a silky foamy texture, and dark chocolate adds a unique subtle bitter element

Menu.name: Broad Creek Special
Menu.desc: Gentleman Jack, Fresh Orange Juice, Luxardo Cherry. A toast to the great outdoors. Built on the local story of fishermen being stranded on the banks of Broad Creek and using what they had to make one last drink

Menu.name: CoCo Choo Choo
Menu.desc: Aged Rum, Dry Gin, Fresh Grapefruit and Orange Juice, Coconut Cream, Cumin. The flavor of the islands found in Raleigh. This delightful concoction of rum, gin, grapefruit juice, orange juice, coconut cream and cumin spice brings vacation home

Menu.name: 1948 Margarita
Menu.desc: Tequila Reposado, Gran Gala, Fresh Lime Juice, Sugar Cane Syrup. A classic brought back from 1948 from the original Margarita Sames recipe. Served on rocks or shaved ice

Menu.name: Viva la Astral
Menu.desc: Tequila Reposado, Fresh Grapefruit and Fresh Lemon Juice, Jalapeno Pepper, Cucumber, Ginger Syrup, Sugar Cane Syrup. Transcend the surrounding mountains with a drink. Tequila, grapefruit juice, lemon juice, and sugar mixed with jalapeño pepper, cucumber, and house made ginger syrup

Menu.name: The Old Fashioned Cocktail
Menu.desc: Bourbon, Marasca Cherries, Orange Wedge. We do this classic cocktail in the post-prohibition style using bourbon, orange fruit, and cherries. It is a fantastic drink we are sure you will enjoy

Menu.name: Elderflower Sour
Menu.desc: Vodka, St. Germain Elderflower, Monin Lime, House-Made Ginger Syrup, Cucumber. The subtle sweetness of a flower coupled with vodka and the crisp dry sweetness of cucumber makes this drink a favorite. We add a bit of sour from preserved lime syrup and fresh ginger to give it a quenching result. A nice and refreshing libation that will have you coming back for more

Menu.name: Rye Manhattan
Menu.price: Rye Whiskey, Italian Vermouth, Regan's' Orange Bitters

Menu.name: The Boulevardier
Menu.price: Rye Whiskey, Campari, Italian Vermouth, Peychaud's Bitters

Menu.price: Rye Whiskey, Cognac, Benedictine, Italian Vermouth, Peychaud's Bitters

Menu.name: Wings
Menu.price: Tossed in your choice of wing sauce: Parm-Garlic / Teriyaki / Thai Sweet Chili / Honey BBQ / Hot Honey / Caribbean Jerk / Spicy Garlic / Classic Buffalo / Atomic Buffalo

Menu.name: Bud Light, Lager - American Light 4.2% ABV 27 IBU St. Louis, MO
Menu.price: Bud Light is brewed using a blend of premium aroma hop varieties, both American-grown and imported, and a combination of barley malts and rice. Its superior drinkability and refreshing flavor makes it the world's favorite light beer

Menu.name: Miller Lite, Pilsner - Other 4.17% ABV 10 IBU Milwaukee, WI
Menu.price: Our flagship brand, Miller Lite, is the great tasting, less filling beer that defined the American light beer category in 1975. We deliver a clear, simple message to consumers: Miller Lite is the better beer choice. What's our proof? 1) Miller Lite is the original light beer. 2) Miller Lite has real beer taste because it's never watered down. 3) Miller Lite is the only beer to win four gold awards in the World Beer Cup for best American-style light lager

Menu.name: Coors Light Lager - American Light 4.2% ABV 10 IBU Golden, CO
Menu.price: Coors Light is Coors Brewing Company's largest-selling brand and the fourth best-selling beer in the U.S. Introduced in 1978, Coors Light has been a favorite in delivering the ultimate in cold refreshment for more than 25 years. The simple, silver-toned can caught people's attention and the brew became nicknamed the "Silver Bullet" as sales climbed

Menu.name: Budweiser Lager - North American Adjunct 5% ABV 12 IBU St. Louis, MO
Menu.price: Known as "The King of Beers," Budweiser was first introduced by Adolphus Busch in 1876 and it's still brewed with the same high standards today. Budweiser is a medium-bodied, flavorful, crisp American-style lager. Brewed with the best barley malt and a blend of premium hop varieties, it is an icon of core American values like optimism and celebration

Menu.name: Belgian White, Witbier, 5.4% ABV 9 IBU Denver, CO
Menu.price: Blue Moon Belgian White, Belgian-style wheat ale, is a refreshing, medium-bodied, unfiltered Belgian-style wheat ale spiced with fresh coriander and orange peel for a uniquely complex taste and an uncommonly smooth finish

Menu.name: Blood Orange, Cider 4.7% ABV Nellysford, VA
Menu.price: A unique blend of blood oranges and local Blue Ridge apples

Menu.name: Hell Yes Ma'am Belgian Strong Golden Ale 9.2% ABV 30 IBU Raleigh, NC
Menu.price: We're a little rebel & rough house. A city that's a healthy heaping of Southern grit topped with a touch of Southern charm. HellYesMa'am is a tribute to Raleigh in the form of a fruity, spicy, pleasantly warming and dangerously drinkable Belgian Golden. We use premium Belgian Pilsner malt, organic cane sugar, noble hops, and a magnificently complex Belgian yeast that gives our Golden its dry, kick-tail complexity. This beauty rings in at 9.2% ABV

Menu.name: Pernicious IPA, IPA - American 7.3% ABV 70 IBU Asheville, NC
Menu.price: Formerly named East Side or Die IPA, Pernicious is our flagship India Pale Ale. With minimum malt complexity, we dry hop this beer with nearly twice the normal amount of hops typical to this style. The combination of juicy, tropical fruit-forward hops with heavy resinous American hops is the epitome of a West Coast IPA, made right here in the Southeast

Menu.name: Breakfast Stout Stout - Oatmeal 8.3% ABV 60 IBU Grand Rapids, MI
Menu.price: The coffee lover's consummate beer. Brewed with an abundance of flaked oats, bitter and imported chocolates, and Sumatra and Kona coffee, this stout has an intense fresh-roasted java nose topped with a frothy, cinnamon-colored head that goes forever

Menu.name: Black Stiletto Stout, Stout - American 6.1% ABV 31 IBU Raleigh, NC
Menu.price: A sexy, silky stout. Aroma recalls roasted barley and caramel. A smooth body on the lighter side for a stout. Enjoyable mouthfeel. Finishes on the sweeter side with noticeable chocolate flavor. Try with spicy foods, red meats, fruit-based desserts, and anything containing chocolate

Menu.name: Traditional Lager Lager - American Amber / Red, 4.4% ABV 16 IBU Pottsville, PA
Menu.price: An iconic American Lager famous for its rich amber color and medium bodied flavor with roasted caramel malt for a subtle sweetness and a combination of cluster and cascade hops, this true original delivers a well balanced taste with very distinct character

Menu.name: Pumking, Pumpkin / Yam Beer - Imperial 8.6% ABV 30 IBU Lakewood, NY
Menu.price: All Hallow's Eve is a time of the year when spirits can make contact with the physical world, and when magic is most potent. It is thought that we harness this magic to brew our powerful pumpkin ale. Not so, but it is with great respect to the magic of their trade that our brewers produce this fine beer. Take a whiff of this complex ale and your journey has just begun. At first sip, a magical spell will bewitch your taste buds, yet anther victim enraptured by the Pumking. COLOR: Deep copper EFFERVESCENCE: Medium carbonation NOSE: Pumpkin, pie spices, buttery crust, vanilla, roasted pecans FLAVOR: Malty sweetness, vanilla, clove, allspice, cinnamon, nutmeg, pie crust BITTERNESS: Low BODY: Medium-light SERVING TEMPERATURE: 40-48°F

Menu.name: Bad Penny, Brown Ale - English 5.2% ABV 25 IBU Raleigh, NC
Menu.price: This dark brown ale is slightly sweet with a caramel and dark fruit finish. A show case of fine English malts, floor malted the old way. We use pale, chocolate, and crystal malts to produce a complex, but easy drinking dark ale. Very reminescent of northern English ales

Menu.name: Dos Equis Ambar, Lager - Vienna 4.7% ABV 25 IBU Monterrey, Nuevo León
Menu.price: Dos Equis Ambar (Amber) is a vienna style lager that was originally brewed by the German-born Mexican brewer Wilhelm Hasse in 1897. The brand was named "Siglo XX" ("20th century") to commemorate the arrival of the new century, and the bottles were marked with the Roman numerals "XX", or "Dos Equis" (two X)

Menu.name: Rübæus, Fruit Beer 5.7% ABV 15 IBU Grand Rapids, MI
Menu.price: Optimizing the flavor of fresh raspberries, Rubaeus is the perfect blend of sweet, tart and refreshing

Menu.name: Vienna Lager, Lager - Vienna 5.2% ABV 18 IBU Roseland, VA
Menu.price: With its amber chestnut colored good looks and smooth malty finish, Vienna Lager was an obvious choice to put into bottles. It blends color and flavor without heaviness or bitterness. Just as Vienna Lagers historically inspired Munich's Oktoberfest beers to evolve, this amber lager has evolved since we opened in 2008 into the award winning beer it is today. Experience the taste and tradition

Menu.name: Modelo Especial, Lager - North American Adjunct 4.5% ABV 18 IBU Mexico City, Distrito Federal
Menu.price: Modelo Especial, a pilsener type beer, was introduced to the market in 1966. Today it is sold in glass bottles as well as cans, which are having an increasing demand due to consumer preferences, making Modelo Especial the leader in the can segment in Mexico. Grupo Modelo says it is a Pilsner, though RB states it is a Pale Lager and BA a American Adjunt Lager

Menu.name: Harvest Time, Pumpkin / Yam Beer 5.5% ABV 16 IBU Raleigh, NC
Menu.price: Harvest Time Pumpkin Ale is a subtly spiced fall ale brewed with real pumpkin that will evoke memories of holidays and family. It is brewed with our own proprietary blend of spices that will make this one of the best-received pumpkin ales available. ABV: 4.5% / IBU: 16. Goes great with: zombie rituals, vampire hunting, walks in a graveyard... after midnight. Available September - October in bottles and draft

Menu.name: Touché IPA, IPA - American 6.8% ABV 76 IBU Smithfield, NC
Menu.price: An aggressively hopped American IPA with 5 different hops. Prominent citrus and floral aroma with a very smooth hop taste. Pours a golden/orange color with a thick white head. The Story: exclamation: touché 1. (in fencing) used as an acknowledgment of a hit by one's opponent. 2. used as an acknowledgment during a discussion of a good or clever point made at one's expense by another person. 3. The brewmaster made this IPA for his wife, Chey

Menu.name: Guinness Draught, Stout - Irish Dry 4.2% ABV 45 IBU St. James's Gate, Dublin
Menu.price: Swirling clouds tumble as the storm begins to calm. Settle. Breathe in the moment, then break through the smooth, light head to the bittersweet reward. Unmistakeably GUINNESS, from the first velvet sip to the last, lingering drop. And every deep-dark satisfying mouthful in between. Pure beauty. Pure GUINNESS. Guinness Draught is sold in kegs, widget cans, and bottles. The ABV varies from 4.1 to 4.3%. Guinness Extra Cold is the exact same beer only served through a super cooler at 3.5 °C

Menu.name: Fat Tire, Red Ale - American Amber / Red 5.2% ABV 22 IBU Fort Collins, CO
Menu.price: After a trip to Europe, New Belgium's co-founder returned to Colorado from Belgium with a handful of ingredients and an idea. Two years later, Fat Tire – named in honor of his inspired bike ride across the Belgian countryside – pedaled its way into the hearts of beer drinkers. Now considered an iconic centerpiece of the craft beer movement, Fat Tire represents the American spirit of craft brewing ingenuity and an irresistible imagination that reminds us all to rediscover our playful side. Fat Tire's unique flavor profile originates from the late 1930s, when local Belgian breweries aimed to satisfy the tastes of visiting British soldiers. English floral hops, subtle malt sweetness and spicy, fruity notes from Belgian yeast made for a balanced yet magical combination. These same characteristics are at the heart of Fat Tire. Classified as an Ameri-Belgo style ale by the revered Great American Beer Festival and World Beer Cup competitions, Fat Tire blends a fine malt presence, fresh herbal hop balance and a touch of fruity yeast to offer drinkers everywhere a timeless craft beer experience with a rare blend of balance and complexity

Menu.name: Corona Light, Lager - American Light 4% ABV 18 IBU Mexico City, Distrito Federal
Menu.price: Outside Mexico, Corona is often served with a wedge of citrus fruit - usually lime, occasionally lemon - inserted into the neck of the bottle. Within Mexico, especially in the south, Corona served with lime is not uncommon, but is not considered mandatory

Menu.name: IPA, IPA - American 6.2% ABV 46 IBU Petaluma, CA
Menu.price: This is our unique version of an ancient style. A style as old as the ocean trade routes of the last centuries Great Ships. Not as old as the equator they had to cross twice enroute

Menu.name: Stella Artois, Lager - Euro 5% ABV 24 IBU Leuven, Vlaams-Brabant
Menu.price: Stella Artois was first brewed as a Christmas beer in Leuven. It was named Stella from the star of Christmas, and Artois after Sebastian Artois, founder of the brewery. It is brewed to perfection using the original Stella Artois yeast and the celebrated Saaz hops. It is the optimum premium lager, with its full flavour and clean crisp taste

Menu.name: Pale Ale Pale Ale - American 5.6% ABV 38 IBU Chico, CA
Menu.price: Our most popular beer, Sierra Nevada Pale Ale is a delightful interpretation of a classic style. It has a deep amber color and an exceptionally full-bodied, complex character. Generous quantities of premium Cascade hops give the Pale Ale its fragrant bouquet and spicy flavor

Menu.name: Two Hearted Ale IPA - American 7% ABV 55 IBU Comstock, MI
Menu.price: Brewed with 100% Centennial hops from the Pacific Northwest and named after the Two Hearted River in Michigan's Upper Peninsula, this IPA is bursting with hop aromas ranging from pine to grapefruit from massive hop additions in both the kettle and the fermenter. Perfectly balanced with a malt backbone and combined with the signature fruity aromas of Bell's house yeast, this beer is remarkably drinkable and well suited for adventures everywhere

Menu.name: Crisp Apple, Cider 5% ABV 10 IBU Cincinnati, OH
Menu.price: A crisp and refreshing cider, its fresh apple aroma and slightly sweet, ripe apple flavor make it hard to resist

Menu.name: Samuel Adams Boston Lager, Lager - Vienna, 5% ABV 30 IBU Boston, MA
Menu.price: Samuel Adams Boston Lager® is the best example of the fundamental characteristics of a great beer, offering a full, rich flavor that is both balanced and complex. It is brewed using a decoration mash, a time consuming, traditional four vessel brewing process discarded by many contemporary brewers. This process brings forth a rich sweetness from the malt that makes it well worth the effort. Samuel Adams Boston Lager® also uses only the finest of ingredients including two row barley, as well as German Noble aroma hops. The exclusive use of two row barley not only imparts a full, smooth body but also gives the beer a wide spectrum of malt flavor ranging from slightly sweet to caramel to slightly roasted. The Noble hops varieties, Hallertau Mittelfruh and Tettnang Tettnanger, add a wide range of floral, piney and citrus notes, which are present from the aroma, through the flavor, to the lingering smooth finish. We take great pride in the Noble hops used in our beers. They are hand selected by Jim Koch and our other brewers from the world's oldest hops growing area. Among the world's most expensive, they cost twenty times as much as other hops

Menu.name: 420 Extra Pale Ale, Pale Ale - American 5.7% ABV 41 IBU Atlanta, GA
Menu.price: SweetWater 420 Extra Pale Ale, our most popular brew, is a tasty West Coast Style Pale Ale with a stimulating hop character and a crisp finish. 1st brewed on April 20th 1997

Menu.name: Red Oak Lager - Amber 5% ABV 18 IBU Whitsett, NC
Menu.price: Red Oak Bavarian Amber Lager is an old-style lager made with imported Munich malt that is custom kilned to our specifications, which gives this beer a one-of-a-kind body and flavor. Our hops are imported from Bavaria, the oldest hop-growing region in the world, and we ferment with a proprietary lager yeast strain (which we do not filter) to give the beer its unique cloudiness and daily supply of Vitamin B. As with all of our beers, Red Oak is brewed in accordance to the 1516 Bavarian Purity Law, contains no preservatives, and is never pasteurized, making it fresh, pure and wholesome

Menu.name: Shotgun Betty, Hefeweizen 5.8% ABV 12 IBU Raleigh, NC
Menu.price: Shotgun Betty is a sexy, tough cowgirl who is always armed and dangerous. Don't be fooled by her good looks, she will have you for an appetizer! That's why we picked her to represent our Hefeweizen. Shotgun Betty is a wheat beer with rich, banana-clove nose and refreshing dry finish. Sound good? Try one. But beware, once Betty gets a hold of you there is no escape

Menu.name: Samuel Adams OctoberFest, Märzen 5.3% ABV 16 IBU Boston, MA
Menu.price: In 1810, the Oktoberfest tradition was born when Munich celebrated the Crown Prince's wedding with a special beer and 16 day party. Our version of this classic style blends rich malts for a hearty, smooth flavor with notes of caramel creating a brew that's perfect for the season, or whatever you're celebrating

Menu.name: Hoppyum IPA, IPA - American 6.25% ABV 78 IBU Winston-Salem, NC
Menu.price: The recipe is simple. Take some hoppy. Add some yum. Nutty malts lend a surprisingly sweet base to copious additions of tangerine-y Simcoe™ hops. Great aroma, superior taste, clean dry finish. One sip will show you why this is our most popular beer . . . followed closely by a strong desire to take another sip

Menu.name: Minute IPA, IPA - American 6% ABV 60 IBU Milton, DE
Menu.price: Our flagship beer. A session India Pale Ale brewed with Warrior, Amarillo & 'Mystery Hop X.' A powerful East Coast I.P.A. with a lot of citrusy hop character. THE session beer for beer geeks like us!

Menu.name: Amstel Light, Lager - American Light 3.5% ABV Zoeterwoude, Zuid Holland
Menu.price: Amstel Light has a rich, hoppy, never-diluted flavor that sets it apart from other light beers

Menu.name: Angry Angel, Kölsch 4.5% ABV 20 IBU Raleigh, NC
Menu.price: Our Kölsch is a refreshingly pale German style Ale. It is cold fermented and cold conditioned to achieve a beautiful balance between biscuit malt flavors and floral hop notes. It is light bodied and finishes somewhat dry to enhance it's easy drinking nature

Menu.name: Bud Light, Lager - American Light 4.2% ABV 27 IBU St. Louis, MO
Menu.price: Bud Light is brewed using a blend of premium aroma hop varieties, both American-grown and imported, and a combination of barley malts and rice. Its superior drinkability and refreshing flavor makes it the world's favorite light beer

Menu.name: Budweiser, Lager - North American Adjunct 5% ABV 12 IBU St. Louis, MO
Menu.price: Known as "The King of Beers," Budweiser was first introduced by Adolphus Busch in 1876 and it's still brewed with the same high standards today. Budweiser is a medium-bodied, flavorful, crisp American-style lager. Brewed with the best barley malt and a blend of premium hop varieties, it is an icon of core American values like optimism and celebration

Menu.name: Clausthaler Classic / Premium, Non-Alcoholic 29 IBU Frankfurt
Menu.price: Labelled as Premium in the UK and the US

Menu.name: Coors Light, Lager - American Light 4.2% ABV 10 IBU Golden, CO
Menu.price: Coors Light is Coors Brewing Company's largest-selling brand and the fourth best-selling beer in the U.S. Introduced in 1978, Coors Light has been a favorite in delivering the ultimate in cold refreshment for more than 25 years. The simple, silver-toned can caught people's attention and the brew became nicknamed the "Silver Bullet" as sales climbed

Menu.name: Corona Light, Lager - American Light 4% ABV 18 IBU Mexico City, Distrito Federal
Menu.price: Outside Mexico, Corona is often served with a wedge of citrus fruit - usually lime, occasionally lemon - inserted into the neck of the bottle. Within Mexico, especially in the south, Corona served with lime is not uncommon, but is not considered mandatory

Menu.name: Dead Guy Ale, Maibock / Heller (Helles) Bock 6.8% ABV 40 IBU Newport, OR
Menu.price: An ale inspired by the style of a German Maibock, brewed using our proprietary Pacman yeast, Dead Guy Ale is deep honey in color with a malty aroma, rich hearty flavor and a well balanced finish. History: In the early 1990s Dead Guy Ale was created as a private tap sticker to celebrate the Mayan Day of the Dead (November 1st, All Souls Day) for Casa U Betcha in Portland, Oregon. The Dead Guy design proved so popular with consumers and especially Grateful Dead fans, that we made it the label for our Maierbock ale. Even though the association with the Grateful Dead band is pure coincidence, we have gratefully dedicated Dead Guy Ale to the Rogue in each of us. The Dead Guy packaging remained unchanged for 25 years until 2017 when we updated the labels with our new design

Menu.name: Doggie Style Classic Pale Ale, Pale Ale - American 5.5% ABV 35 IBU Frederick, MD
Menu.price: Citrus, grassy, and slight perfume hop character balanced with a sweet malt body

Menu.name: Dos Equis Special Lager, Lager - North American Adjunct 4.45% ABV 10 IBU Monterrey, Nuevo León
Menu.price: A crisp, refreshing, light-bodied malt-flavored beer with a well-balanced finish. A Lager that drinks like a Pilsner. A liquid embodiment of living life to the fullest. A beverage made from pure spring water and the choicest hops. A beer with such good taste, it's chosen you to drink it

Menu.name: Dragon's Milk, Stout - American Imperial / Double 11% ABV 31 IBU Holland, MI
Menu.price: The beer you hold in your hand, Dragon's Milk Ale, is a crown jewel of New Holland Brewing Company. It is the unrivaled result of painstaking processes – both creative and scientific. We could tell you about the centuries-old tradition of the term, Dragon's Milk, or we could tell you about the history, craftsmanship and challenges of what's important, the beer inside this bottle. Roasty malt character intermingled with deep vanilla tones, all dancing in an oak bath

Menu.name: Golden Monkey, Belgian Tripel 9.5% ABV 25 IBU Downingtown, PA
Menu.price: Experience the sweet, sensual aromas and flavors of our famous Belgian-Style Tripel. Immerse yourself in rich notes of fruit and spice and savor its dry finish. Nose is loaded with Belgian yeast character. Banana, clove, isoamyl. Body is equally fruity with light earthy hop character. Boozy with a dry finish

Menu.name: Heineken, Lager - Euro 5% ABV 19 IBU Zoeterwoude, Zuid Holland
Menu.price: Heineken is a 5% ABV euro pale lager, made by Heineken International since 1873. It is available in a 4.3% alcohol by volume, in countries such as Ireland. It is the flagship product of the company and is made of purified water, malted barley, hops, and yeast. In 1886 H. Elion finished the development of the Heineken A-yeast. This is the yeast that is still used for the beer. The beer is force carbonated. It is popular in the United States, Europe and Middle Eastern countries

Menu.name: Hell's Belle, Pale Ale - Belgian 7% ABV 30 IBU Raleigh, NC
Menu.price: This style originated in Belgium to compete with the pilsners from Czechoslovakia, Germany, and Poland. It is a fruity ale with very strong carbonation, with complex, spicy flavors like cloves

Menu.name: Hi-Pitch Mosaic IPA, IPA - American 6.7% ABV 55 IBU Asheville, NC
Menu.price: A balanced Western North Carolina IPA with bright citrus and tropical fruit aromas. Expect big grapefruit, tangerine and subtle melon flavors from the chorus of Mosaic & Centennial hops to balance out the malt in this dank & drinkable ale

Menu.name: Hoegaarden Wit / Blanche, Witbier 4.9% ABV 15 IBU Hoegaarden
Menu.price: Spiced with coriander and orange peel

Menu.name: HogWild IPA, IPA - American 6.7% ABV 108 IBU Fuquay Varina, NC
Menu.price: HogWild is a veritable fest of hops. This IPA is designed to let the hops shine through! The flavor is not hidden with sweet malts and is brewed with Chinook, Columbus, Cascade, then dry hopped with Magnum and Willamette. Go Wild with this refreshing IPA

Menu.name: India Pressed Apple (IPA) Cider 4.7% ABV Nellysford, VA
Menu.price: A west-coast style dry-hopped cider featuring Ahranum, Citra, and Centennial hops to compliment the bite of local Granny Smith apples

Menu.name: Lager, Gluten-Free 4.6% ABV 20 IBU Portland, OR
Menu.price: Omission Lager is a refreshing and crisp beer, brewed in the traditional lager style. Perfect for a variety of beer drinking occasions, Omission Lager's aromatic hop profile offers a unique, easy-drinking beer for those looking for a lighter and approachable beer style

Menu.name: Long Hammer IPA, IPA - American 6.2% ABV 44 IBU Seattle, WA
Menu.price: Redhook Long Hammer IPA is a West Coast classic. The generous addition of hops during the brewing and fermentation process gives our India Pale Ale its characteristic bitterness and piney citrus aroma and flavor. Piney aromas and citrus flavors come from a generous addition of hops during the boil and dry-hopping at the end of fermentation. Tracing its heritage from another Redhook classic beer, Ballard Bitter, Long Hammer IPA is one of America's favorite IPAs and Seattle's #1 local IPA

Menu.name: Miller Lite, Pilsner - Other 4.17% ABV 10 IBU Milwaukee, WI
Menu.price: Our flagship brand, Miller Lite, is the great tasting, less filling beer that defined the American light beer category in 1975. We deliver a clear, simple message to consumers: Miller Lite is the better beer choice. What's our proof? 1) Miller Lite is the original light beer. 2) Miller Lite has real beer taste because it's never watered down. 3) Miller Lite is the only beer to win four gold awards in the World Beer Cup for best American-style light lager

Menu.name: Modelo Especial Lager - North American Adjunct 4.5% ABV 18 IBU Mexico City, Distrito Federal
Menu.price: Modelo Especial, a pilsener type beer, was introduced to the market in 1966. Today it is sold in glass bottles as well as cans, which are having an increasing demand due to consumer preferences, making Modelo Especial the leader in the can segment in Mexico. Grupo Modelo says it is a Pilsner, though RB states it is a Pale Lager and BA a American Adjunt Lager

Menu.name: Negra Modelo, Lager - Vienna 5.4% ABV 16 IBU Mexico City, Distrito Federal
Menu.price: Negra Modelo is a Vienna lager-style beer (though the brewery classifies it as a Munich dunkel) first brewed in Mexico by Austrian immigrants, and was introduced as a draft beer in 1926. Negra Modelo comes in an unusually shaped, wide brown bottle with a trademark gold label. Label and ABV varies across different countries

Menu.name: Not Your Father's Root Beer (5.9%) Root Beer 5.9% ABV Wauconda, IL
Menu.price: Not Your Father's Root Beer is a category-defining craft specialty ale brewed with unique spices. Brewer Tim Kovac's creativity and painstaking commitment to flavor complexity results in an unmistakable offering that masterfully blends hints of sarsaparilla, wintergreen, anise, and vanilla. A smooth and balanced Ale, NYFRB has broad appeal – from discerning craft beer drinkers to non-beer drinkers

Menu.name: Pacifico Clara, Lager - North American Adjunct 4.5% AB 15 IBU Mexico City, Distrito Federal
Menu.price: Cerveza Pacífico Clara, better known as Pacifico, is a Mexican pilsner-style beer. It was first brewed in 1900 when three Germans opened a brewery, the Cerveceria del Pacífico in Mazatlán. Cerveza Pacifico is named so because the Pacifico brewery is located in the Pacific Ocean port city of Mazatlán, in the state of Sinaloa, México. Its label includes a picture depicting a lifesaver encompassing a hill with the port's lighthouse, known locally as "Cerro del Crestón." In Mazatlán, the beer is available in three different size bottles: "cuartitos" (6 fl. oz), "medias" (12 fl. oz.), and "ballenas" (32 fl. oz.). "Clara" means clear, as opposed to "obscura" (dark)

Menu.name: Pear Cider, Cider 4.7% ABV Nellysford, VA
Menu.price: Our bold cider makers skillfully blend New Zealand pears and local apples from the Blue Ridge Mountains to create Bold Rock Pear. This refreshingly delicious pear cider is interestingly complex and superbly drinkable

Menu.name: People's Porter, Porter - American 5.8% ABV 42 IBU Winston-Salem, NC
Menu.price: People's porter is a robust English-style brew with a dark, ruby hue. Complex chocolate, caramel and toffee notes give way to an herbal bitterness, finishing with a pleasant finish of espresso

Menu.name: Peroni Nastro Azzurro, Lager - Euro 5.1% ABV Roma, RM
Menu.price: NOTE: "Peroni" Original and "Peroni Nastro Azzuro" are two different beers. Ensure you are checking into the correct one. Peroni Nastro Azzurro is 5.1% in alcohol by volume. The beer was crafted with typical Italian care, and designed with the Mediterranean palate in mind. Roberto is the third generation from the Cavalli family to be master brewers for Birra Peroni, ensuring the high quality and standards of the beer. Italian passion, attention to detail and craftsmanship are the ingredients that now, and forever, will ensure the superior and authentic Italian taste of Peroni Nastro Azzurro

Menu.name: Racer 5 IPA®, IPA - American 7.5% ABV 75 IBU Healdsburg, CA
Menu.price: This hoppy American IPA is a full bodied beer brewed with American pale and crystal malts, and heavily hopped with Chinook, Cascade, Columbus and Centennial. There's a trophy in every glass. 2009 Great American Beer Festival® American-Style Strong Pale Ale – GOLD 2009 Colorado State Fair – Best of Show 2006 Great American Beer Festival® American-Style Strong Pale Ale – SILVER 2005 Great American Beer Festival® American-Style Strong Pale Ale – SILVER 1999 Great American Beer Festival® India Pale Ale - GOLD

Menu.name: Shiner Bock, Lager - Dark 4.4% ABV 13 IBU Shiner, TX
Menu.price: Bock reflects the tradition of genuine Bavarian beers as a brew only a craftsman like Kosmos Spoetzl, trained in the "Old Country," could bring to life. With its deep amber color, distinctive rich flavor and full body, Shiner Bock demonstrates the care of a handcrafted brewing process to bring forth a mellow taste free of the bitter aftertaste found in many micro, specialty and imported beers. Just think of it as Shiner smooth

Menu.name: Smithwick's, Red Ale - Irish 4.5% ABV St. James's Gate, Dublin
Menu.price: Smithwick's is a clear beer with a rich ruby color and creamy head. Clean and delicate aroma with different individual notes: from the top fermentation by the Smithwick yeast come aromatic esters creating a fruity aroma. The Aroma Hops added late in the boil contribute clean fresh floral notes. Ale Malt contributes aroma hints of biscuit and caramel. Refreshing and clean taste with a gentle balance of bitterness from the hops added early in the boil, sweet/malty notes from the ale malt, and hints of roast/coffee from the roasted barley

Menu.name: Wells Banana Bread Beer, Fruit Beer 5.2% ABV Bedford, Bedfordshire
Menu.price: ABV of 5.2% in bottles, and 4.5% on cask. A silky, crisp, and rich amber-colored ale with a fluffy head and strong banana note on the nose

Menu.name: Young's Double Chocolate Stout, Stout - Milk / Sweet 5.2% ABV 25 IBU Bedford, Bedfordshire
Menu.price: The original dark beer brewed with real chocolate

Menu.name: Wine
Menu.price: We have invested in multiple climate-controlled wine coolers so that all our wines will be served at their optimal temperature. This will make even our most modestly priced wines reveal their finest characteristics

Menu.name: Jacob's Creek Two Lands Cabernet Sauvignon, Australia
Menu.price: Generous, rich and silky with blackberry, cassis and plum notes. Perfect balance with a hint of subtle oak.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Rocca Montepulciano d'Abruzzo, Italy
Menu.price: Intense ruby red hue with violet highlights. Dry, full, velvety taste with good persistence.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Tiamo Chianti, Tuscany, Italy
Menu.price: 90% Sangiovese and 10% Cabernet Sauvignon. Deep garnet color. It has an intense bouquet with hints of licorice, spice and red fruits.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Bodegas Pingao Rioja, Spain
Menu.price: Plush and approachable with complex notes of bitter cherries, blue fruits, cassis and tobacco.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: La Celia Reserva Cab Franc / Malbec Blend, Mendoza, Argentina
Menu.price: Spicy, aromatic and fruity. Firm and silky tannins.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Rabbit Ridge Allure Red Blend, Paso Robles, CA
Menu.price: Aroma of blackberry, blueberry, raspberry and wintergreen. Moderate long finish, spicy and peppery.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Di Majo Norante Sangiovese, Italy
Menu.price: Dry and mellow wine with a bright red color. Fresh, fruity bouquet with a hint of violet, red berries and leather.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Pascual Toso Malbec Estate, Mendoza, Argentina
Menu.price: Plum and quince aromas with a rich and long finish accented by vanilla and oak.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Jacob's Creek Double Barrel Cabernet Sauvignon, Australia
Menu.price: Complex, ripe, and layered. Tannins are evident at the front that gives way to a mid-palate filled with ripe cassis and tapenade. Aromas of cassis, mint, dark olive and caramel.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: Dry Creek Valley Meritage, Sonoma, CA
Menu.price: Aromas of dried floral, bright red fruit and red cherry. On the palate, it has silky lushness and elegant tannins.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: Twenty Bench Cabernet Sauvignon, California
Menu.price: Ripe black cherry and blackberry. Creamy and dense with hints of dark chocolate, espresso and black pepper.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Terrapura Cabernet Sauvignon, Colchagua Valley, Chile
Menu.price: Intense aromas of red fruits with pepper and a hint of cassis. On the palate, it has good structure, round and lasting tannins with toasted aromas, elegant and subtle eucalyptus notes.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Jamieson Ranch Light Horse Pinot Noir, California
Menu.price: Silky, sumptuous cherries and subtle earthy aromatics of morning dew and pine. Hints of oak with a graceful finish.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Maretima Nero d'Avola, Italy
Menu.price: Deep ruby red with violet notes. Intense perfume with hints of clove, well-matured red and black fruits and black pepper. Good structure and persuasive tannins. The aftertaste is persistent and harmonious.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Belasco de Baquedano Malbec, Mendoza, Argentina
Menu.price: Fruity aromas of cherries, blackberries and plums. Warm and rounded on the palate. Pleasant aftertaste.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Line 39 Merlot, Central Coast, CA
Menu.price: Ripe black cherry, plum, dark chocolate and French oak. Juicy and ripe.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Evolution Pinot Noir, Willamette Valley, OR
Menu.price: 100% Pinot Noir. Light, fruit forward, silky and rich.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Renato Ratti Barbera d'Asti, Italy
Menu.price: Intense, ruby red bouquet of ripe fruit with a full flavor and a long undercurrent of spices. Balanced acidity and tannins.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Ancient Peaks Zinfandel, California
Menu.price: 100% Zinfandel presents nuanced aromas of raspberry, blueberry, tobacco and white pepper. The palate is deep and chewy. Hints of spice emerge on a finely structured finish.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: La Mozza I Perazzi Sangiovese, Italy
Menu.price: 85% Sangiovese, 5% Syrah, 3% Ciliegiolo and 2% Colorino. Juicy dark fruit mingles with spice and licorice on the palate. Bright ripe cherry and soft texture.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Nino Costa Langhe Nebbiolo, Italy
Menu.price: Youthful Barolo, light bodied. Rose petals and violets on the nose with an elegant, dry finish.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Sophenia Malbec Reserve, Mendoza, Argentina
Menu.price: Bright red fruits bounce from the glass along with subtle spice and cedar notes. Smooth and velvety with sweet tannins.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Lagone Super Tuscan, Tuscany, Italy
Menu.price: Deep ruby with purple hues. Delicate with notes of cherry, vanilla, beef and herbs. The palate is dry, structured and elegant with a lengthy and smooth finish.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Gran Passione Corvina-Merlot Blend, Veneto, Italy
Menu.price: Intense purple color. Full-bodied with rich dark blackberry and black cherry flavors balanced by a solid structure due to elevated alcohol content, acidity and soft tannins.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Vinum Cellars Red Dirt, Paso Robles, CA
Menu.price: Medium plum color with a garnet hue. Intense crushed raspberry aromas fill the glass, backed by licorice and white pepper. Juicy palate with ripe black cherry finish.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Albertina Cabernet Sauvignon, Hopland, CA
Menu.price: Softer tannins with flavors and colors more intense. Fruit-forward with berry flavors and oaked just right.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Dry Creek Valley Mariner Meritage, Sonoma, CA
Menu.price: Aromas of blueberry, vanilla and cherries with hints of clove, cinnamon, black licorice and mocha. The palate has dark berries with cedar.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: Bodegas Luzon Jumilla Red 2012 Spain
Menu.price: Firm aromas of black plum, black cherry and sugar beet. Flavors of chocolate, herbal berry, and minty, dry oak notes.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Auka Malbec, La Consulta, Argentina
Menu.price: Deep red color. Intense aromas of cherries, and plums combined with vanilla, chocolate and coffee. Full-bodied, with soft, sweet tannins.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Mocali I Piaggioni Super Tuscan, Italy
Menu.price: Youthful expression of Sangiovese offers hearty cherry aromas along with spice and vanilla at the back.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Vigneti Zabu Nero d'Avola, Sicily, Italy
Menu.price: 100% Sambuca di Sicilia area grapes. Intense aroma of red fruit, balsamic and floral notes. Warm on the palate, long finish, aftertaste of woodland flowers.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Acumen Mountainside Red Blend, Napa, CA
Menu.price: Full-bodied, aromas of black cherries, English roses, mocha, sweet earth and blackberry pie. Long, pleasant finish.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: Ghost Pines Red Blend, California
Menu.price: Flavors of ripe red, blue and black fruits with a full-bodied structure. Notes of leather, brown sugar, spice and cocoa wrapping the smooth mid-palate with a velvet texture.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Sidewood "Adelaide Hill" Shiraz, Australia
Menu.price: Elegant aromas of raspberry, blueberry, dark plum with hints of vanilla spice. Tastes of blackberry and chocolate. Rich and silky tannins.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Ramsay Cabernet Sauvignon, North Coast, CA
Menu.price: Bing cherries and red currants in the nose carried forward to the palate with bright, mouth-filling fruit and a hint of tannin.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Annabella Pinot Noir, Carneros, CA
Menu.price: Dark burgundy with brooding nose of ripe strawberries, forest floor and shiitake mushrooms. Flavors of white fig, cocoa and vanilla bean. Smooth, integrated oak with a finish of clove and orange peel.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Tinto Figuero "12 Month" Ribera del Duero, Spain
Menu.price: 100% Tempranillo. Cherry red color with blue highlights. Aromas of ripened blackberries, licorice and mature red berries. Touches of oak, chocolate, spices and coffee notes. Balanced and full-flavored tannins.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: Cuttings Cabernet Sauvignon, California
Menu.price: Full-bodied and complex. Ripe fruit, black cherry and black plum flavors are rich and concentrated.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: Klinker Brick Zinfandel, Lodi, CA
Menu.price: Berries and spice on the nose and dark, sweet fruit fill the palate with a hint of black pepper. Long, lingering finish.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Jim Barry Clare Valley Shiraz, Australia
Menu.price: Bright blend of Shiraz, Cabernet and Malbec. Mint, thyme and bay leaf.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Nero Dei Venti Chianti Classico, Tuscany, Italy
Menu.price: Intense ruby red color with persistent hints of blackberry, raspberry and vanilla.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Elizabeth Spencer Grenache, Mendocino, CA
Menu.price: Ripe raspberries and strawberries on the nose. Fresh and light on the palate. Finishes crisp with lingering mineral notes.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Parcel 41 Merlot, Napa, CA
Menu.price: Ruby red in the glass. Aromas of black currant, saddle leather and milk chocolate with a delicate floral note. Round mouth-filling tannins with flavors of chocolate covered cherries and smoky espresso.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Blue Rock Baby Blue - Limited Quantity, Sonoma, CA
Menu.price: A proprietary red blend made in an approachable style that is delicious on release. Blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Syrah, Merlot and Malbec. Classical structure with dried herb and juicy currant.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: La Rioja Alta Vina Alberdi Reserva 2012 Spain
Menu.price: Nose shows great intensity. Fruity aromas of cherries, blackberries and plums. Warm and rounded palate.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: True Myth Cabernet Sauvignon, Paso Robles, CA
Menu.price: Rich yet smooth with aromas of blackberry, blueberry, pepper and cassis. Flavors of dark red fruits with hints of cedar spice, cocoa powder and caramelized oak. Long lingering finish.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Atrea Old Soul Red Petite Syrah 2012 Mendocino, CA
Menu.price: 89 pts - Dry wine tastes ripe and jammy, full of blackberry and boysenberry flavors. Smooth but not soft. Dark chocolate flavors.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Renato Ratti Nebbiolo, Italy
Menu.price: A slightly faded ruby red. Fine, delicate and persistent bouquet with trace scents of strawberry and raspberry. Pleasantly bitter yet velvety.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Palagetto Chianti Colli Senesi, San Gimignano, Italy
Menu.price: Intense ruby red. Aromas of fruit with hints of floral. Soft on the palate and slightly tannic.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Liberty School Merlot, Central Coast, CA
Menu.price: Deep opaque ruby-black color, blackberry and blueberry aromas, velvety tannins, balanced acidity with a long silky finish.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Clos du Bois Cabernet Sauvignon, Alexander Valley, CA
Menu.price: Deep purple color. Aromas of ripe blackberry with hints of milk chocolate and oak barrel spice. Good texture and smooth tannins.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Zenato Valpolicella Rippasa, Italy
Menu.price: DOC. Blackberry and black currant with spice and pepper. Smooth and viscous with well-balanced acidity.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: Sant' Antonio Valpolicella Ripasso, Veneto, Italy
Menu.price: 70% Corvina and Corvinone, 20% Rondinella and 10% Croatina and Oseleta. Semi-dry, soft, savory and fairly tannic with a spicy aftertaste.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Talbott Logan Pinot Noir, Central Coast, CA
Menu.price: Aromas and flavors of cherry and blackberry with subtle elements of vanilla and cinnamon spice. Smooth tannins with rich red berry notes finished with smoky vanilla and hard spices.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Palagetto Rosso di Montalcino, Italy
Menu.price: 100% Sangiovese. Balanced tannins, smooth and moderately acidic. Hints of violets and smoke.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Louis Martini Cabernet Sauvignon, Sonoma, CA
Menu.price: Rich, superbly balanced, copious yet supple tannins. Flavors of wild berries, plum, licorice and mocha. Full-bodied and mouth-coating texture on the palate leads to a long and graceful finish.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: Warwick Three Cape Ladies Pinotage Blend, South Africa
Menu.price: Nose is very perfumed with hints of peppermint infusing black plum and black cherry. Palate is medium bodied with supple tannins.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Round Pond Kith & Kin Cabernet Sauvignon, Rutherford, CA
Menu.price: Beautifully balanced with aromas of fresh berries, leather and sweet French oak. Palate rounds out into a creamy cherry pie a la mode with a full finish.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: La Giaretta Amarone, Italy
Menu.price: Cassis, dried plums, ripe black fruits. Rustic, full-bodied, great length.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: Gallo Signature Cabernet Sauvignon, Napa, CA
Menu.price: 93+ pts - Vivid, complex and fragrant. Raspberry bramble, blackberry, dried herbs and licorice. Assertive tannins melt smoothly with toasty oak streaked with Tahitian vanilla.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: Palagetto Sottobosco Super Tuscan, Italy
Menu.price: Ruby red with violet highlights. Aroma is intensely spicy with notes of smoked oak and black currant. Gentle oak finish.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Mount Peak Rattlesnake Zinfandel, Napa, CA
Menu.price: Robust flavors of ripe blueberries, blackberries, cherry jam and fig tied together by a brambly undertone. Accents of white pepper, licorice and smoke weave through the wine. Luscious finish.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: William Hill Cabernet Sauvignon, Sonoma, CA
Menu.price: Well-balanced with a rich palate of dark fruits with subtle hints of caramel and cocoa.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: Frank Family Petite Syrah, Napa, CA
Menu.price: Rich purple color. Aromas of baked plums and blueberries. On the palate, mild flavors of vanilla and leather with tart blackberry flavors. Full-bodied with silky tannins.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: Frank Family Cabernet Sauvignon, Napa, CA
Menu.price: Classic Napa Cabernet. A Rutherford base with aromas of cocoa, red currant, cinnamon, and blackberry. Full-bodied with moderate tannins and a long finish.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: Outlot Cabernet Sauvignon, Alexander Valley, CA
Menu.price: 90 pts - Deep purple, black currant, cherry, fennel, cola and licorice. Plush tannins, medium-firm finish.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Château Batailley Pauillac Lions de Batailley, Left Bank, France
Menu.price: Cigar box, tobacco, crème de cassis and forestry create an aromatic profile. On the palate, it offers soft, polished dark red fruits, spice, blackberry and tobacco. Nearly forward in style.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: Nabucco Monte Delle Vigne, Italy
Menu.price: Ruby red with violet reflections. Aroma is intense, ethereal, hints of wild berries, dried flowers and coffee. The palate is enveloping, soft and persistent with silky tannins.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: La Storia Cabernet Sauvignon, Alexander Valley, CA
Menu.price: Dense ruby purple color. Aromas and flavors of blueberries, blackberry and black licorice. Aged in French oak. Medium dense with fresh, juicy, soft tannins.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Bonacchi Brunello, Italy
Menu.price: Dark-skinned berry and baking spice aromas. The easy-going palate offers juicy black cherry and mocha flavors with a touch of white pepper. Dusty tannins for a drying finish.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Gigi Rosso Barolo, Italy
Menu.price: Intense garnet red. Ethereal fragrances of fruit jam and spices. The palate is full-bodied, warm, intense, invigorating, dry and tannic, with a long finish and characteristic "goudron"(tar) aftertaste.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: Sexual Chocolate Red Blend, California
Menu.price: Syrah / Malbec blend. Intense combination of ripe, dark fruit. Long, smooth finish.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: Gaja Promis Super Tuscan, Italy
Menu.price: Floral aromas turn into an earthy bouquet. The palate is fresh and juicy with notes of red and black fruits - raspberry, strawberry, and mulberry. Creamy, smooth tannins and the finish is sapid with a smoke and spice character.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: Château Laplagnotte-Bellevue Saint-Emilion Grand Cru, Right Bank, France
Menu.price: Rich red fruit and woodland scents soar. Dense core of ripe fruits come elegantly wrapped in finely crafted tannins. Cassis, dark chocolate and subtle spice tones make this wine hard to resist.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Brancala-Ilitraia Red Blend, Italy
Menu.price: 92 pts - Presents aromas of mature black skinned fruit, sunbaked earth and cedar. Concentrated, polished palate delivers juicy black cherry, grilled herb, clove, and tobacco. Velvety tannins provide support. .
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: White Oak Cabernet Sauvignon, Sonoma, CA
Menu.price: Aromas of cherry, plum and cranberry, underlying oak notes with hints of vanilla. Flavors of plum and red currant. Lengthy finish reinforced by a smooth tannin structure.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Frog's Leap Cabernet Sauvignon, Rutherford, CA
Menu.price: Rich and deep mocha aromas. Superb balance with long and deep flavors. A dark and ample palate with exceptional balance.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: Mastroberardino Radici Taurasi, Italy
Menu.price: Full-bodied with complex aromas principally violet and blackberry. Notes of plum, bitter cherry, black pepper and strawberry jam. Decant for the full experience.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: Zenato Amarone, Veneto, Italy
Menu.price: Concentrated, cherry and spice, full-bodied. Perfume of dried cherry and roasted herbs, truffle and smoke. Dense and chewy palate featuring sweet, luscious ripe fruit on the lengthy finish.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: Shirvington "Mclaren Vale" Cabernet Sauvignon, Australia
Menu.price: Perfumed nose of red cherry and spicy cedar. Subtle hints of mint leaf and star anise. The palate begins with strawberries and morphs into riper black currants. Savory tannins, fresh acidity, lengthy and generous finish.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: Col d'Orcia Brunello di Montalcino, Italy
Menu.price: Ruby with violet hues. Ample and lasting bouquet. Typical notes of ripe, red berries. Tastes well-structured and complex with soft ripe tannins. Long and pleasant aftertaste.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: Schweiger Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon 2011 Napa, CA
Menu.price: Aromas of rich blackberry, currant, plum and cherry. A velvety core of lush red fruit, generously proportioned, endless finish.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: Reynolds Family Cabernet Sauvignon, Rutherford, CA
Menu.price: Savory aromas of smoky grilled vegetables, fresh cracked pepper and dried blackberries. The tannins are oak dominated.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: Château Beau-Site Saint Estephe, Left Bank, France
Menu.price: Forward, easy to drink, this wine has polished tannins and ripe red fruits sifted in herbs and cedar, with ruby-colored berries and a cocoa finish.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: G.D. Vajra Barolo 2013 Italy
Menu.price: Red fruit and plum flavors with hints of flowers and pine needles. The finish is reminiscent of bushes. Elegant acidity and ripe tannins.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: Napanook Cabernet Sauvignon, Napa, CA
Menu.price: 92 pts - Open-knit, opulent style in keeping with the vintage's signature, it offers luscious notes of bay leaf, lavender, red and black currants, plum sauce, licorice and Christmas fruitcake.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: Anderson Conn Valley Cabernet Sauvignon - Estate Reserve, Napa, CA
Menu.price: Rich, full-bodied, concentrated and structured. Sweet tannins with a big, big finish.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: Sojourn Cellars - Rutherford Cabernet Sauvignon, Napa, CA
Menu.price: Intense dark color, robust aromatics. Rutherford Dust profile shines in its dark cherry, earth and mocha flavors.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: Parolvini Garganega Pinot Grigio, Italy
Menu.price: Straw yellow, the scent is delicate, hints of acacia flowers. Dry, warm, structured and harmonious flavor.
Menu.desc: Gl Reserve

Menu.name: Raats Chenin Blanc, South Africa
Menu.price: Distinctive yellow apple and pineapple core with notes of green melon and limes.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Pollo Creek Pinot Grigio Rosé, Moldova
Menu.price: Aromas of floral, butter, cream, almond and citrus. Tasting notes of lemon, apple and pear.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Oxford Landing Sauvignon Blanc, Southern Australia
Menu.price: Pale straw-green color, fresh and zesty aromas of lemon, passion fruit and guava. Light palate of lemongrass and papaya.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Zenato Pinot Grigio, Italy
Menu.price: Aromas of Key limes and white peaches. Smooth and refreshing finish.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Parolvini Pinot Grigio, Italy
Menu.price: Brilliant light straw color. Pleasantly fruity, intense and persistent. Cold, sterile microfiltration bottling technique.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: La Galope Sauvignon Blanc, France
Menu.price: Subtle floral aroma and spicy notes of fresh citrus and grapefruit. Palate is fresh and fruity with a lingering finish.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: La Galope Chardonnay Blend, France
Menu.price: Aromas of white flowers, acacia, pears and sweet almonds. Fresh palate with hints of honey lemon.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Domaine Reine Juliette Picpoul de Pinet, France
Menu.price: Lip-smacking grapefruit tang, fresh acidity. Unoaked, dry, long finish.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Blindfold Chardonnay Blend, California
Menu.price: Blended with white Rhône grapes. Luscious entry of toasted hazelnut and mandarin. Finish is rich and creamy.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: Rosehaven Rosé, California
Menu.price: Red berries, a hint of raspberry with a little minerality on the finish.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Bogle Chardonnay, California
Menu.price: Rich, round entry, touches of tropical pineapple and guava. Finishes like the last bite of crème brûlée.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: PJ Valckenberg - Madonna Riesling Kabinett, Germany
Menu.price: Aromas of pear, yellow apple, as well as candied lemon and peach on the palate. Semi-sweet with fresh acidity.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Folonari Moscato, Provincia di Pavia, Italy
Menu.price: Lovely notes of gardenias and white peaches brought to life by a slight effervescence and crisp acidity.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Storypoint Chardonnay, California
Menu.price: Buttery flavors and aromas of ripe yellow apple, pear and white peach are enriched on a plush palate. Silky and refreshing finish.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Fire Road Sauvignon Blanc, Marlborough, New Zealand
Menu.price: Light bodied, dry and crisp, this wine is full of gooseberry and passion fruit flavors.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Gigi Rosso Gavi, Gavi, Italy
Menu.price: Intense straw yellow color with greenish highlights. The bouquet is delicate and characteristic with a pleasantly dry, fresh and harmonious taste.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: The Snitch Chardonnay Blend, California
Menu.price: Touch of Roussane creates bright and tropical fruit, apple and pear on the nose. The palate is rich and balanced by bright acidity.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: J Vineyards Pinot Gris Judy Jordan, Russian River Valley, CA
Menu.price: Notes of candied pineapple, lemongrass, white peach and jasmine. Fruit forward with complex palate with notes of orange blossom and a sliver of minerality.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Shooting Star Riesling, California
Menu.price: Fermented in stainless steel. Notes of honeysuckle, orange blossom, bright citrus and fresh grape. Hints of petrol typical of Riesling.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Terrapura Chardonnay, Chile
Menu.price: This wine has a light golden color, with delicate aromas of citrus and tropical fruits. It is fresh and round on the palate with honey and citric notes. Unoaked.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Quercus Rosé - Exclusive, Brda, Slovenia
Menu.price: Intense fruit forward, flavors of raspberry, currant and cherry. Pleasant acidity and a long finish. Stainless steel fermentation.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Twelfth Night "Marlborough" Sauvignon Blanc, New Zealand
Menu.price: Medium-bodied, with aromas of elderberry and passion fruit that yield to a palate of citrus, ripe tropical fruit and a dry mineral finish. Flavors are crisp and herbal with fresh acidity.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Gota Prunus Blanco, Portugal
Menu.price: Nose has aromas of passion fruit, pineapple and wild herbs. Well-rounded palate with intense fruit layers.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Antebellum Saffronne Rosé, Western Cape, South Africa
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Tiefenbrunner Pinot Grigio, Italy
Menu.price: Intense, almost straw in color. The nose exhibits pear. Light in style very fresh and agreeable, displaying bright fruit on the palate with nice acidity.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Wente Estate Grown Chardonnay, Livermore Valley, CA
Menu.price: 50% oak, 50% steel fermentation. Crisp flavors of melon, grapefruit, green apple and subtle hints of oak. Long refreshing finish.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Priest Ranch Sauvignon Blanc, Napa, CA
Menu.price: Flavors of melon, crisp grapefruit and hints of passion fruit with layers of lemon and vanilla. Stainless steel fermentation.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Orin Swift Blank Stare Sauvignon Blanc, Russian River Valley, CA
Menu.price: Tight at first, then generous on the nose. Classic aromas of white peach, pear, freshly cut grass, stone, butterscotch and clove. Shards of minerality, white fig and lemon zest dominate the palate.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: Steele Cuvee Chardonnay, Mendocino County, CA
Menu.price: Steele Wine flagship white wine. Flavors of apple pear, citrus and just a hint of oak.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Bogle Chardonnay - Phantom, California
Menu.price: Green apple and pear transform into spicy flavors of baked apple pie. Creamy, luscious mouthfeel.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Tangent Viognier 2013 San Luis Obispo, CA
Menu.price: Begins with aromatics of apricot and peach with a bright floral note. Full-bodied and creamy wine with mild acidity. Intense flavors of peach, honeydew and cantaloupe.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Orin Swift Mannequin, Russian River Valley, CA
Menu.price: Nose opens with lemon, honeydew, butterscotch, and honeysuckle with accents of jasmine, white pepper and fennel pollen. Massive palate of ripe white peach, nectarines, pineapple and honey.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: Villa Huesgen Riesling, Moselle Valley, Germany
Menu.price: 100% Riesling. Tastes of fruit minerals with well-balanced acidity.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Paul Anheuser Pinot Noir Blanc, Germany
Menu.price: Slightly muted tones of strawberry and red apple are glazed with caramel in this slightly off-dry white pinot noir. Light-bodied and soft in acidity. It's an easy, approachable wine.
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: White Oak Chardonnay, Russian River Valley, CA
Menu.price: Golden delicious apple, Anjou pear and toasty oak note form the basis of the balanced Chardonnay. Silky texture and a long finish.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Frank Family Chardonnay, Napa, CA
Menu.price: Aromas of toasted brioche, baking spices and candied lemon rind. Full-bodied and creamy with flavors of yellow apple, lemon curd, baked pear, melon and hints of oak toast.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Frog's Leap Sauvignon Blanc, Napa, CA
Menu.price: 92 pts - Peach blossom and white flower give way to a very light slatey aroma that introduces a crisp minerality flavor. .
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: ZD Wines Chardonnay, California
Menu.price: Intense, fruit forward and well balanced. Aromas of pineapple, lime zest and pear mingle with hints of vanilla and orange blossoms. The palate is rich and full-bodied with exceptional balance. Finishes long and lasting.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: Talbott Sleepy Hollow Chardonnay, Santa Lucia Highlands, CA
Menu.price: Elegant aromas of jasmine and sandalwood along with richer notes of brioche and butterscotch. The palate offers lively minerality. Satiny smooth finish with touches of cinnamon, vanilla and hard spices.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: Frog's Leap Chardonnay, Napa, CA
Menu.price: Carneros Chardonnay. Pure, clean, refreshed, restrained and drinkable.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Burly Sauvignon Blanc, Napa, CA
Menu.price: First aromas are of white peach and pear that lead to stone fruit and pineapple. The palate has rich flavors of nectarine and lemon meringue. Smooth lingering finish.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Fess Parker Ashley's Chardonnay, Los Olivos, CA
Menu.price: Aromas of white peach, apple, pear, honey, vanilla, baking spices and a touch of oak. Flavors of pear, citrus, lemon crème, green apple, pastry crust, vanilla and baking spices.
Menu.desc: Btl

Menu.name: Tiamo Prosecco, Italy
Menu.price: Straw yellow color. The wine offers fresh and rich fruity aromas of apple and pear with a hint of citrus fruit that fades into the floral bouquet. .
Menu.desc: Gl

Menu.name: Taittinger Champagne, France
Menu.price: This Champagne is a blend of some 30 Chardonnay and Pinot Noir vineyards. Elegant and fresh. Active on the palate with bright core fruits and zesty citrus and mineral flavors.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: Veuve Clicquot Champagne, France
Menu.price: The predominance of Pinot Noir provides the structure that is so typically Clicquot, while a touch of Pinot Meunier rounds out the blend. Chardonnay adds the elegance and finesse. Complex aromas of ripe apple and light cream. Active and layered on the palate with a dry, medium acidity and finish.
Menu.desc: Btl Reserve

Menu.name: Ricossa Brachetto, Italy
Menu.price: Enticing deep cherry red color. Bouquet of raspberry, cherry and delicate rose petals. A pleasant acidity complements the sweet and juicy flavors of the wine.
Menu.desc: Gl
